syringe.medical.Name: Health Boost Syringe
syringe.medical.Description: Description Health boost syringe made for heavy duty combat use. This substance provides you with major max health boost for short amount of time however this comes with strong side effects.

antiradpills.Name: Pseudoephedrine
antiradpills.Description: Description Pseudoephedrine is a phenethylamine and a diastereomer of ephedrine with sympathomimetic property. Pseudoephedrine displaces norepinephrine from storage vesicles in presynaptic neurones, thereby releasing norepinephrine.
antiradpills.Stats: Stats This item has no consumable benefits, it's solely used as mixing reagent.

antiradpills{1}.Name: Methamphetamine
antiradpills{1}.Description: Description A synthetic substance. Normally seen as a white powder, it acts as a stimulant of the central nervous system (CNS). Causes hypertension and tachycardia with feelings of increased confidence, sociability and energy.

paper.Name: Red Phosphorus
paper.Description: Description Red phosphorus is the most common allotrope of phosphorus. It is used in organic synthesis and chemical warfare including igniters, incendiaries, screening smoke ammunition and smoke signal.
paper.Stats: Stats This item has no consumable benefits, it's solely used as mixing reagent.

sticks.Name: Marihuana
sticks.Description: Description Marijuana is the dried leaves and flowers of the Cannabis sativa or Cannabis indica plant. Stronger forms of the drug include high potency strains - known as sinsemilla (sin-seh-me-yah), hashish (hash for short), and extracts.

blueberries.Name: Cocaine
blueberries.Description: Description Cocaine is a tropane alkaloid and stimulant drug obtained primarily from the leaves of two coca species. It is most commonly used as a recreational drug and euphoriant.

syringe.medical{1}.Name: Anti Radiation Syringe
syringe.medical{1}.Description: Description Syringe is filled with salt of stable iodine that can help block radioactive iodine from being absorbed by the thyroid gland, thus protecting this gland from radiation injury.
